radiographic_examinations.findings: Sinus bradycardia at heart rates of 103 and 104 bpm; prolonged QTc intervals of 0.58 s and 0.59 s.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: QTc shortened to 0.48 s one week after the introduction of /H9252-blocker therapy.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Confirmed diagnosis of Romano-Ward syndrome with an initial QTc of 0.57 s.
